<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Entreat with Forebears](/Feats.aspx?ID=1812) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 139 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
a bloodline that corresponds with a creature trait

</column>

---

Something about your presence causes creatures of your bloodline to, consciously or not, recognize you as one of their own, and you become inured to their tricks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6), [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5), and [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) checks when interacting with creatures that have the trait corresponding to your bloodline, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception and saving throws against such creatures. For example, an [aberrant bloodline](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=1) sorcerer would gain this benefit against creatures with the [aberration](/Traits.aspx?ID=1) trait. The GM is the final arbiter of which creatures match your bloodline.
name: Entreat with Forebears
prerequisite: a bloodline that corresponds with a creature trait
